column1: About six weeks after the beginning of the half
column2: as Tom and Arthur were sitting one night before supper beginning their verses
column7: do you know anything of Martin?""Yes
column8: said Tom, taking his hand out of his back hair, and delighted to throw his Gradus ad Parnassum on to the sofa; I know him pretty well. He's a very good fellow
column9: but as mad as a hatter. He's called Madman
column10: you know. And never was such a fellow for getting all sorts of rum things about him. He tamed two snakes last half
column11: and used to carry them about in his pocket; and I'll be bound he's got some hedgehogs and rats in his cupboard now
column12: and no one knows what besides.""I should like very much to know him
column13: said Arthur; he was next to me in the form today
column14: and he'd lost his book and looked over mine
column15: and he seemed so kind and gentle that I liked him very much.""Ah
column18: said Tom, and getting called up and floored because he hasn't got them."
